d415956deb14.description: Home to some of the best stories on medium. Look around, relax and enjoy one with a sip of coffee.
d415956deb14.name: The Coffeelicious
d415956deb14.shortDescription: Home to some of the best stories on medium.

paragraphs.text: And hence, it is the purpose of the artist to talk about what goes on in the world and in their heart, truly, passionately and ferociously.
paragraphs.name: 73e7

paragraphs.text: Some of my friends who are great poets, writers and artists create the most amazing works when they are in a state of imbalance created by restlessness, anxiety, depression or any other intense emotion that feeds within them, the desire to create.
In such a scenario, it becomes almost impossible to believe that your creative efforts can ever count to something significant.

513c7fd7965b.title: You talk when you stop being at peace with your thoughts.

paragraphs.text: You talk when you stop being at peace with your thoughts. You write when you stop being at peace with your existence.
paragraphs.name: f20e

ca5f30635e69.title: You are not writing to readers here, you are writing to yourself, and that is not the purpose of…

paragraphs.text: You are not writing to readers here, you are writing to yourself, and that is not the purpose of publishing, that is for journaling. This is one of those things you should have kept to yourself because it is just you talking to you.
paragraphs.name: 986f

683757726ca6.title: Thank you for this beautiful, reflective piece.

paragraphs.text: Thank you for this beautiful, reflective piece. I often think about why I create and I like your insight that we each perceive the world in an unprecendented way and that our perception matters.
paragraphs.name: 51db

f5be2a78d249.title: I think there is a correlation between creativity and time.

paragraphs.text: I think there is a correlation between creativity and time. At it’s most basic, creativity is for problem-solving(i.e. the future). For most of us, creativity is about being in the moment (the now). Some of us will create history with our art.
paragraphs.name: 6d20

7934e253c6f8.title: Authenticity is worth much more than originality. Xx

paragraphs.text: Authenticity is worth much more than originality. Xx

61ebc81b5c6.title: And, if we are a true “maker”, the making will nag us until we give in and make.

paragraphs.text: And, if we are a true “maker”, the making will nag us until we give in and make. Thank you for this piece. I’ve been a professional writer for at least thirty years and never felt there was too much writing until I started working on the internet. You’ve brought me back to the basics.
paragraphs.name: 07d8

5a76498ae01d.title: It’s one of the great lies that our brain tells us, isn’t it?

paragraphs.text: It’s one of the great lies that our brain tells us, isn’t it? That your creative efforts aren’t significant. You are the only you, and even if the idea is something someone else has had or is having at the same time, you will always do it differently than they are. Because you are a unique person colored by your memories, family, environment, friends…
paragraphs.name: 50dd

fe1341152d4e.title: I became old enough stopping every creative opportunity I had.

paragraphs.text: I became old enough stopping every creative opportunity I had. I abandoned, I destroyed, I felt embarrassed. There are only bits and tiny pieces or memories of those moments. I think time is running out. But I swear I will do it. It’s never too late. Thanks for writing about this.
paragraphs.name: 97a9

dfd5071f9693.title: “the form of art that you are attracted to is often a reflection of an imbalance within you”

paragraphs.text: “the form of art that you are attracted to is often a reflection of an imbalance within you”
paragraphs.name: 95f5

paragraphs.text: How true. I was smirking while you described yourself as being in a constant state of motion, challenged by plans, projections and patience, because I see myself as the opposite side of the coin.
paragraphs.name: 92d9

virtuals.subtitle: How true. I was smirking while you described yourself as being in a constant state of motion, challenged by plans, projections and patience…

content.subtitle: How true. I was smirking while you described yourself as being in a constant state of motion, challenged by plans, projections and patience…

500d08dd00f8.title: Great scene on this in “The Gift of Asher Lev” where he shows his daughter’s classroom how art is…

paragraphs.text: Great scene on this in “The Gift of Asher Lev” where he shows his daughter’s classroom how art is all about the way an artist interprets the world through their own eyes.
paragraphs.name: e87d

c91994b4d57e.title: Judeo/Christian/Islamic theology says that mankind was created in God’s image.

paragraphs.text: Judeo/Christian/Islamic theology says that mankind was created in God’s image. A god who has no physical form, but who creates. Whose essence is to create. And we are created in that image. How could we not create?
paragraphs.name: c3df

2a14abd2c619.title: Lol. I noticed. Never thought it was a thing. I write best when I’m severely depressed.

paragraphs.text: Lol. I noticed. Never thought it was a thing. I write best when I’m severely depressed.
paragraphs.name: d7b4

229a86cdc51c.title: One of my favourite articles I’ve read on Medium.

paragraphs.text: One of my favourite articles I’ve read on Medium. We spend so much time thinking about who we’re trying to please through our creation, that we forget about the benefits creation brings to us. That we should be doing it for ourselves, as much as we’re doing it for everyone else.
paragraphs.name: 618c

paragraphs.text: Really got me thinking about why I write.
paragraphs.name: ee4a

paragraphs.text: Thanks, Shreya :)
paragraphs.name: 6f20

virtuals.subtitle: Really got me thinking about why I write.

content.subtitle: Really got me thinking about why I write.

4772d88acf1b.title: What a beautifully written, heart-expanding piece!

paragraphs.text: What a beautifully written, heart-expanding piece! Thank you for writing it, for speaking to so many of us who sometimes wonder, “why bother? It’s all been said, sung, done before…and who’s really going to care if I never create anything ever again? The world will still turn…” We create because it heals us, balances us. We are pure creation: we are both nouns and verbs. Gratitude to you, Shreya…
paragraphs.name: cfb0

2757e542dd32.title: Why should you create at all?

paragraphs.text: Why should you create at all?
paragraphs.name: 1b1e

paragraphs.text: When everyone is doing the same thing, does doing even matter?
paragraphs.name: 7a14

virtuals.subtitle: When everyone is doing the same thing, does doing even matter?
virtuals.metaDescription: What is the entire purpose behind creation? This blog talks about the reasons why an artist should never cease to create and how why creativity matters.

paragraphs.text: This is a lovely piece written about the ebbs and flows of being a creator. Great insight, experience, and reflection is shown throughout. Thank you for sharing.
